Description: zgrep in gzip before 1.3.5 does not properly sanitize arguments, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via filenames that are injected into a sed script.

Description: Cisco NX-OS allows local users to gain privileges and execute arbitrary commands via the sed e option, aka Bug IDs CSCtf25457 and CSCtf27651.
References: CISCO:20131004 Cisco NX-OS Software Input Validation Vulnerability   |   URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4077   |   BID:62849   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/62849   |   OSVDB:98127   |   URL:http://osvdb.org/98127   |   SECUNIA:55191   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/55191

Description: Cisco NX-OS 6.2(2) on Nexus 7000 switches allows local users to cause a denial of service via crafted sed input, aka Bug ID CSCui56136.
References: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=34131   |   CISCO:20140505 Cisco Nexus 7000 Denial of Service Vulnerability   |   URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0684

Description: sed is limited to 24 patterns when using the delete command. *With 24 patterns, sed filters correctly 'build-aux':* *With 25 patterns, sed fails to filter 'build-aux*':
plus (`+`) not a metacharacter with --posix option, escaped o. The plus character can't seem to be used as a metacharacter when both the `-E` and `--posix` options are given.
sed escape bug. The escape '\c\' fails at the end of a regex. It's a bug in older sed-4.2.2, but the fix is perhaps not your expected behaviour of allowing '/' after '\c\'.
testsuite_bug_regex*_LDADD not defined thus the building of bug-regex* fail if configure with --with-included-regex.
Segfault / null pointer access in function str_append_modifie. With a malformed input (see attachmend) sed can crash in the function str_append_modified()

'y' command doesn't allow a comment after it one the same line. Unlike other commands, the current implementation of the 'y' command does not allow a comment on the same line if the command is not terminated" by a ';'"
sed 4.3-1 segmentation fault (core dumped) : Error in `sed': realloc(): invalid next size: 0x000000000209aed0
possible bug in \c escape handling. There might be a small bug in processing of GNU extension escape sequence \c". When the character following "\c" is a backslash
References: the code consumes only one character
Phase: leading to inconsistent and incorrect output."

Description: sed/utils.c temporary file handling code review. The code handling temporary file seems to be fragile and contains dead chunks. ck_fclose() is (theoretically) vulnerable into a double close, because open_files still contains file being closed while calling do_ck_fclose(). In some error conditions, do_ck_fclose() can call panic(), which manipulates with open_files and tries to fclose() all files there, including that one just closed.

using -e instead of a literal newline in s replacement fails. If any -e or -f options are specified, the script of editing commands shall initially be empty. The commands specified by each -e or -f option shall be added to the script in the order specified.

sed: tmp file left when there are errors and -i is used.  running a command like sed -i s//b/ F" would fail to remove a temporary file named sedXXXXXX (for random XXXXXX) in the directory alongside F."

behavior of --follow-symlinks on stdin. When reading from stdin, --follow-symlinks causes failure since v4.2.1-13-g84066bf: echo abc | sed --follow-symlinks s/a/d/ sed: cannot stat -: No such file or directory
